main event: A U.S. Coast Guard ship sighted an unidentified object in the sky at 0910 GMT on July 17, 1958, in latitude 16.0 North, longitude 76.5 West.
interesting points: The object changed direction from heading eastward to approximately northeast by east.
The object disappeared completely at 2518 GMT when bearing 54 degrees true.
The object was surrounded by haze and there was no sound.
Three white lights were seen intermittently, with one light ray at least 8 degrees in length and another approximately two-thirds of that length, appearing to trail the object.
The sighting was witnessed by the chief radio officer, second mate, and two able-bodied seamen on bridge watch.
sighted object: an unidentified object in the sky
